#### Definition

A sequence of vectors $(x_n)$ in a Hilbert space $H$ is called a Riesz
sequence if there exist constants $0 < c \leq C$ such that
$$c\left( \sum_n |a_n|^2 \right) \leq \left\| \sum_n a_n x_n \right\|^2 \leq C \left( \sum_n |a_n|^2 \right)$$
for all sequences of scalars $(a_n) \in l^2$. A Riesz sequence is called
a Riesz basis if $\overline{\mathop{\rm span} (x_n)} = H$.

If $H$ is a finite-dimensional space, then every basis of $H$ is a Riesz
basis.
